summary: An email from an FBI Victim Services Division Program Manager requesting TSA assistance for a victim traveling from Durango to Miami to attend an Epstein briefing. The victim has a temporary paper ID and is traveling with a support person believed to be her boyfriend.

persons.name: Program Manager
persons.role: FBI Victim Services Division Program Manager
persons.context: Author of the email requesting TSA assistance for a victim traveling to an Epstein briefing in Miami.

connections.description: FBI Victim Services Division is assisting the victim with travel arrangements and security escort to attend the Epstein briefing.
The victim is traveling with a support person believed to be her boyfriend to the Epstein briefing.

events.title: Victim travel to Epstein briefing
events.description: A victim of Epstein, assisted by FBI Victim Services, is scheduled to travel from Durango to Miami via Phoenix to attend an Epstein briefing.

events.title: Epstein briefing in Miami
events.description: A briefing related to the Epstein case was scheduled in Miami, requiring victim travel and FBI coordination.

keyFacts: The FBI Victim Services Division was actively assisting victims in traveling to attend an Epstein-related briefing in Miami in October 2019.
A victim was traveling with only a temporary paper Colorado ID and no picture ID, requiring special TSA assistance and escort through security.
The victim had a support person, believed to be her boyfriend, traveling with her to the briefing.
The travel was booked by the Victim Services Division, indicating organized victim support for case-related events.
